original: LINDGREN, Gustaf Malcolm Birch-, Tekn Dr, Arkitekt, Stockholm, f Sthlm 1/10 92 av hovintendent G A H Lindgren o Anna Birch, gm Gunborg Melin. Studex Sthlm 11, KTH 11—15, KonstHS 15—17, konsthist stud v StHS 21—22, stud stadsplanekonst v Harvard Univ o Massachusetts Inst of Techn i Boston Mäss USA 23, tekn dr v KTH 34, studieresor bl a till Engl, Tyskl, Frankr, Ital o USA. Prakt arkit i Sthlm sed. 15, tjg arkit utom stat v Byggn.styr 18, bitr arkit i Fångvårdsstyr 30. Utfört, ombyggt eller tillbyggt ett flert lasaretts- o sanat.byggn, restaur kyrkor, utfört Skidfrämj :s anläggn v Fiskartorpet o Frostavallen, Rämshyttans turiststation, hyreshus, affärsbyggn mm. Av trycket: Sv lasaretts-byggnader (grad.avhandl 34) mfl bidrag t in- 0 utl publ. RVO.
translated: LINDGREN, Gustaf Malcolm Birch-, PhD in Technology, Architect, Stockholm, born in Stockholm on 1st October 1892, son of court superintendent G.A.H. Lindgren and Anna Birch, married to Gunborg Melin. Completed his secondary education in Stockholm in 1911, studied at the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) from 1911 to 1915, the Royal University College of Fine Arts from 1915 to 1917, and art history studies at the Academy of Fine Arts from 1921 to 1922. Studied urban planning at Harvard University and Massachusetts Institute of Technology in Boston, USA, in 1923. Earned his PhD in Technology from KTH in 1934. Undertook study trips to England, Germany, France, Italy, and the USA. Practiced architecture in Stockholm since 1915, worked as an architect for various building authorities from 1918, and as an assistant architect for the Prison and Probation Service from 1930. Completed, renovated, or expanded several hospital and sanatorium buildings, restored churches, and built facilities for the Swedish Ski Association at Fiskartorpet and Frostavallen, Rämshyttan tourist station, apartment buildings, commercial buildings, etc. Published work includes "Swedish hospital buildings" (PhD thesis, 1934) and various contributions to national and international publications. Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa.

structured.name: Gustaf Malcolm Birch-Lindgren

alumniOf.name: Royal University College of Fine Arts

structured.description: Gustaf Malcolm Birch-Lindgren, born on 1st October 1892 in Stockholm, Sweden, was a Swedish architect. He earned a PhD in Technology and completed his education at various institutions, including the Royal Institute of Technology, the Royal University College of Fine Arts, and the Academy of Fine Arts where he studied art history. He also studied urban planning at Harvard University and Massachusetts Institute of Technology in Boston, USA. Gustaf Lindgren worked as an architect in Stockholm since 1915 and held positions as an external architect for the Building Authority and as an assistant architect for the Prison and Probation Service. He completed numerous projects including hospital buildings, church restorations, and various other buildings such as apartment complexes and commercial structures. Gustaf Lindgren published several works, including his PhD thesis titled "Swedish hospital buildings" in 1934, and made contributions to national and international publications. He was honored as a Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa.
